data.name: Various Assignments
data.description:
This kata aims to teach a concept.

You are to define three generic classes: `NormalGeneric`, `StrictGeneric` and `WeirdGeneric` such that:
  * A `NormalGeneric` of `Dog` can be assigned to a `NormalGeneric` of `Animal`, but not vice-versa
    * i.e.: `val animal: NormalGeneric[Animal] = NormalGeneric[Dog]` compiles
    * but `val animal: NormalGeneric[Dog] = NormalGeneric[Animal]` does not
  * A `StrictGeneric` of `Animal` can only be assigned to a `StrictGeneric` of `Animal`
    * i.e.: `val animal: StrictGeneric[Animal] = StrictGeneric[Animal]` compiles
    * but `val animal: StrictGeneric[Animal] = StrictGeneric[Dog]` does not
    * nor does `val animal: StrictGeneric[Dog] = StrictGeneric[Animal]`
  * A `WeirdGeneric` of `Animal` can be assigned to a `WeirdGeneric` of `Dog`, but not vice-versa
    * i.e.: `val animal: WeirdGeneric[Dog] = WeirdGeneric[Animal]` compiles
    * but `val animal: WeirdGeneric[Animal] = WeirdGeneric[Dog]` does not


where `Animal` and `Dog` are defined in the tests such that `Dog` extends `Animal`
